rules.ruleString: (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {OHS1000} and Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {IDE2810})

description: Students are encouraged to develop a greater understanding of furniture design and methods of production. Topics cover aspects of ergonomics, production processes in a variety of materials and the aesthetic aspects of furniture. Further sophistication in the demands of users. Furniture as components of exterior environments, and larger modules such as office spatial requirements. Studio project work is undertaken involving the development of furniture designs to meet particular technical and cultural requirements.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
